title:
A few sharp estimates of harmonic functions with applications to Steklov
  eigenfunctions
abstract:
On smooth compact manifolds with smooth boundary, we first establish the
sharp lower bounds for the restrictions of harmonic functions in terms of their
frequency functions, by using a combination of microlocal analysis and
frequency function techniques by Almgren and Garofalo-Lin. The lower bounds can
be saturated by Steklov eigenfunctions on Euclidean balls and a family of
symmetric warped product manifolds. Moreover, as in Sogge and Taylor, we
analyze the interior behavior of harmonic functions by constructing a
parametrix for the Poisson integral operator and calculate its composition with
the spectral cluster. By using microlocal analysis, we obtain several sharp
estimates for the harmonic functions whose traces are quasimodes on the
boundary. As applications, we establish the almost-orthogonality, bilinear
estimates and transversal restriction estimates for Steklov eigenfunctions, and
discuss the numerical approximation of harmonic functions.
